title: Jamaican Jerk Chicken
author: Iowa Girl Eats
description: Jamaican jerk chicken with red beans and rice. Inspired by a tropical island vacation

dishes.name: jerk chicken
steps: Combine the [#2|1 tbsp|allspice], [#3|1 tbsp|thyme], [#4|1 tbsp|sugar], [#5|1 tsp|sage], [#6|0.75 tsp|nutmeg] [#7|0.75 tsp|cinnamon] and [#8|0.75 tsp|cayenne pepper] into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, stir together the [#9|190 ml|vinegar], [#13|1|juiced|orange juice], [#11|65 ml|olive oil], [#12|65 ml|soy sauce], and [#14|1|juiced|lime juice].

Slowly whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until smooth. Mix in [#15|2|chopped|spring onions], [#16|1|chopped|white onions] and [#17|5 clove(s)|peeled and crushed|garlic], then add the [#1|4|chicken breasts] to the bowl, turning over to cover completely in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour, and up to overnight.

Grill the chicken for 4-5 minutes per side, brushing the marinade over while grilling. When no longer pink in the middle, remove to a plate, and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve with your favorite BBQ or hot sauce.

dishes.name: red beans and rice
steps: Heat [#18|1 tbsp|oil] in a large saucepan over medium heat, then add [#17|1 clove(s)|minced|garlic], [#15|1|chopped|spring onion] and [#3|0.25 tsp|thyme], and saut√© for 2 minutes.

Add [#19|200 g|drained and rinsed|beans], [#20|250 ml|water] and [#21|125 ml|coconut milk] to the pan, then stir and bring to a boil. Add in [#22|1 cup|rice] and [#23|0.5 tsp|salt], then place a lid on top, turn the heat down to low, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until all the liquid as been absorbed, and rice is tender.
